TITLE: Using Rendertron Middleware in Express
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to integrate the Rendertron middleware into an Express application. It requires the 'express' and 'rendertron-middleware' modules. It configures the middleware with a proxy URL and then serves static files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/render-examples/rendertron/blob/master/middleware/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const express = require('express');
const rendertron = require('rendertron-middleware');

const app = express();

app.use(rendertron.makeMiddleware({
  proxyUrl: 'http://my-rendertron-instance/render',
}));

app.use(express.static('files'));
app.listen(8080);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Screenshot Endpoint Example
DESCRIPTION: Example GET and POST requests to the `/screenshot` endpoint. This endpoint is used to verify page rendering.  Additional options can be passed as a JSON string in the POST request body, as defined in the Puppeteer documentation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/render-examples/rendertron/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: HTTP
CODE:
```
GET /screenshot/<url>
POST /screenshot/<url>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Render Endpoint Example
DESCRIPTION: Example GET request to the `/render` endpoint.  This endpoint renders a specified URL and serializes the page. The `mobile` query parameter is used to request the mobile version of the site.
SOURCE: https://github.com/render-examples/rendertron/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: HTTP
CODE:
```
GET /render/<url>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Meta Tag for Status Code
DESCRIPTION: Example of setting the HTTP status code returned by the rendering service. This is achieved by adding a meta tag with the name `render:status_code` and specifying the desired status code in the content attribute.
SOURCE: https://github.com/render-examples/rendertron/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<meta name="render:status_code" content="404" />
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Rendertron Locally
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the Rendertron CLI.  This starts the Rendertron server, rendering pages as requested.
SOURCE: https://github.com/render-examples/rendertron/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
rendertron
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Rendertron Middleware
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the express and rendertron-middleware npm packages, which are required for using the Rendertron middleware in an Express application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/render-examples/rendertron/blob/master/middleware/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
$ npm install --save express rendertron-middleware
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Rendertron Globally
DESCRIPTION: Command to install Rendertron globally using npm.  This makes the `rendertron` command available in the command line.
SOURCE: https://github.com/render-examples/rendertron/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install -g rendertron
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Rendertron Locally
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Rendertron server locally using npm. Requires a local instance of Chrome to be installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/render-examples/rendertron/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Encoded URL Example
DESCRIPTION: Example of a correctly encoded URL for use with Rendertron.  This shows how to encode query parameters using `encodeURIComponent` in JavaScript, specifically encoding `page=home` for a URL.
SOURCE: https://github.com/render-examples/rendertron/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
https://rendertron.onrender.com/render/http://my.domain/%3Fpage%3Dhome
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building Rendertron
DESCRIPTION: Commands to clone the Rendertron repository, install dependencies, and build the project.  These commands are necessary to set up a local development environment for Rendertron.
SOURCE: https://github.com/render-examples/rendertron/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/GoogleChrome/rendertron.git
cd rendertron
npm install
npm run build
```
